text: Ah yeah, I see now, so it's just one form per blog. On my test portal multi-language blog the forms have (Language) appended to the form name so it's easy to differentiate but on the client portal there's only a super opaque ID and the blog name - but the blog name is the same for all versions of the multi-language blog. The mind boggles, but trial and error should solve this. Thanks

maybe you have a quite long blog title?
Usually it adds the lang at the end of the blog title like so:
Form ... {{ blog tittle }} (English)
This is how it looks on the test portal
Maybe there's something else fishy going on, there's been a whole bunch of different actors mucking about in this particular portal
maybe those forms where created on the early stages of HubSpot multilingual for blogs.
Anyhow, if you go to a published post, you should be able to see in the DOM the form ID
Yep, I'm going to push the form comments back to production and do just that
Also yes, I think this portal might be ancient
Ah, so it's <Blog name> comment form <Blog ID>. Easier to fish ID's from settings page. Thanks again.
